Subject: Does NEAT Facilitate Link Values of 0, max and min?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211599040; y=ISYiVEAjx6EJ9Tw5wE1qNdZpWg3mm2Q1UKovAfP-bKf4sMMrsAX9
X-Yahoo-Profile: jeffreyclune

Hello all-

I was just looking at some NEAT genomes and noticed that they have many link
values of exactly -3 (min), 3 (max), and 0.

Does NEAT have something that facilitates the production of max, min and 0?
I know HyperNEAT facilitates the production of zeros...does NEAT?

PS. I am using Jason's HyperNEAT C++ package, in case that is different in
this respect. 

If anyone has any thoughts, I would appreciate it. It is affecting an
analysis I am doing for an upcoming paper.

Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University
jclune@...
www.msu.edu/~jclune
